sentences.soussou: I kena! Tana mu a ra?
Tanante, Ala xa baraka! I fan?
sentences.french: Bien, que Dieu benisse! Et toi?
Ma voiture ne vient pas aujourd'hui.
sentences.english: My car is not coming today.
You have a lot going on? / How's your situation?

sentences.soussou: Eh, travail gbo! Mais ca va.
sentences.french: Oui, beaucoup de travail! Mais ca va.
sentences.english: Yeah, lots of work! But it's okay.

sentences.french: Que la paix. Grace a Dieu.
Je ne connais pas cet endroit.
Attends ici. Je viens te chercher.
sentences.english: Wait here. I'll come get you.

sentences.soussou: A siga mosquee. A fafe bientot.
sentences.french: Il est parti a la mosquee. Il arrive bientot.
sentences.english: He went to the mosque. He's coming soon.

sentences.french: Oui. Je n'ai pas de parapluie.
sentences.english: Yes. I don't have an umbrella.

sentences.french: Le soleil a passe deux. Deux heures.
Moi aussi j'arrive. On vient ensemble!
sentences.english: Me too I'm coming. We're coming together!

sentences.french: Je ne peux pas. Demain, d'accord?
Va au marche. Achete du riz.
sentences.english: Go to the market. Buy rice.
Okay. How many kilos should I buy?

sentences.soussou: I na minde? N'na i fen gbo!
sentences.french: Tu es ou? Je te cherche beaucoup!
sentences.english: Where are you? I've been looking for you a lot!

sentences.french: Pardon! Mon telephone ne marchait pas.

sentences.soussou: A cuisine koui. A dege rafe.
sentences.french: Elle est dans la cuisine. Elle prepare a manger.
sentences.english: She's in the kitchen. She's cooking.

sentences.french: C'est combien le taxi pour aller a Conakry?
sentences.english: How much is a taxi to go to Conakry?

sentences.french: Cinquante mille. Mais tu peux negocier!
sentences.english: Fifty thousand. But you can negotiate!

sentences.french: Oui! Bois de l'eau. Bois de l'eau.

sentences.soussou: Eh! Nun bi tan whon' a rasa!
sentences.french: Eh! On vient de l'acheter aujourd'hui!
sentences.english: Hey! We just got it today!

sentences.french: Ou est le chemin de cet hopital?
sentences.english: Where is the road to this hospital?

sentences.soussou: Siga tout droit, kirin kole. A gauche apres.
sentences.french: Va tout droit, au bout. Apres a gauche.
sentences.english: Go straight, at the end. Then left.

sentences.french: Riz sauce arachide. Tu en veux?
sentences.english: Rice with peanut sauce. You want some?

sentences.soussou: Etan birin lafia, Ala xa baraka!
sentences.french: Ils vont tous bien, grace a Dieu!
Il/elle ne vient pas. Il/elle est malade.
sentences.english: He/she is not coming. He/she is sick.

sentences.soussou: Ay! Ala xa a kisi! Ana hopital?
sentences.french: Oh! Que Dieu le/la guerisse! Il/elle est a l'hopital?
sentences.english: Oh! May God heal him/her! Is he/she at the hospital?

sentences.soussou: Whon' kha meeting commence wakhati yiri?
sentences.french: Notre reunion commence a quelle heure?
sentences.english: What time does our meeting start?

sentences.french: Neuf heures. Le retard c'est pas bon!
sentences.english: Nine o'clock. Being late is not good!

sentences.french: Cinq cent mille. Tres bonne qualite!
sentences.english: Five hundred thousand. Very good quality!
Let's get inside the house quickly!
My keys. Have you seen them?

sentences.french: Est-ce que tu comprends ma situation?
Oui, je comprends. C'est un gros probleme.
sentences.english: Yes, I understand. It's a big problem.

sentences.french: Je vais a Kindia. Des affaires.

sentences.english: Hey! Very very hot! Be careful!
How many children do you have?

sentences.french: J'arrive, ma voiture est deja la.
sentences.english: I'm coming, my car is already here.
Cool! Wait. I'm coming down now.

sentences.soussou: Ay! Gui muxundi gbo! Bougie be?
sentences.french: Ah! Ca ennuie beaucoup! Il y a une bougie?
sentences.english: Oh! This annoys a lot! Is there a candle?

sentences.soussou: A lafia un peu. Fatigue tan.
sentences.french: Il va un peu. Juste fatigue.
sentences.english: He's okay a bit. Just tired.

sentences.soussou: Ntan wama. Merci. I khafe gbo?
sentences.french: Ca va. Merci. Tu as beaucoup de soucis?
sentences.english: I'm okay. Thanks. You have a lot going on?

sentences.french: Le bus part a quelle heure pour Kamsar?
sentences.english: What time does the bus leave for Kamsar?

sentences.french: Sept heures du matin. Depart fixe!
sentences.english: Seven in the morning. Fixed departure!

sentences.soussou: Awa, ntan kolon. Gui m'ma probleme.
sentences.french: Oui, je sais. C'est pas un probleme.
sentences.english: Yes, I know. That's not a problem.
Thank you very much! Clean heart.

sentences.french: C'est combien cette huile de palme?
sentences.english: How much is this palm oil?

sentences.soussou: Vingt mille le litre. I ra yiri?
sentences.french: Vingt mille le litre. Tu en veux combien?
sentences.english: Twenty thousand per liter. How many do you want?

sentences.soussou: Nun bi froid gbo. Hiver fafe.
sentences.french: Aujourd'hui il fait tres froid. L'hiver arrive.
sentences.english: Today is very cold. Dry season is coming.

sentences.soussou: Awa. Veste rafa. M'ma vouloir malade.
sentences.french: Oui. Prends ta veste. Je ne veux pas tomber malade.
sentences.english: Yes. Bring your jacket. I don't want to get sick.

sentences.french: Un peu fort. Tu ajoutes du sucre?

sentences.soussou: Siga droite, apres gauche. Ecole yire.
sentences.french: Va a droite, apres a gauche. L'ecole est la-bas.
sentences.english: Go right, then left. The school is there.
Thank you! Is it very far?
They're all coming to the wedding.

sentences.french: Que Dieu benisse! Famille au complet!

sentences.english: Give me that. I need it.
Take it. But give it back tomorrow!

sentences.french: Nous ne venons pas. Trop de travail.
sentences.english: We (not you) are not coming. Too much work.
I understand your situation a lot.
Thank you. This bothers me a lot.

sentences.french: Il y a une pharmacie pres d'ici?
Oui. Au coin a droite. Cinq minutes.
sentences.english: Yes. On the right corner. Five minutes.

sentences.soussou: Ntan kolon un peu. N'na apprendre.
sentences.english: I know a bit. I'm learning.

sentences.french: Tres! Des reunions tous les jours.
Sa voiture arrive. Il/elle est pres.
sentences.english: His/her car is coming. He/she is near.
Look at me! This is important.
Okay, I'm looking. What is it?
Are you going to the market?

sentences.soussou: Awa. I ra besoin di ra?
sentences.french: Oui. Tu as besoin de quoi?
Ah! J'ai peur. Dans la maison vite!
sentences.english: Oh! I'm scared. Inside the house quickly!

sentences.soussou: M'ma yite encore. Retard une heure.
sentences.french: Pas encore arrive. Une heure de retard.
sentences.english: Not arrived yet. One hour delay.

sentences.soussou: A lafia, Ala xa baraka! A i sonyi salam.
sentences.french: Elle va bien, grace a Dieu! Elle te passe le bonjour.
sentences.english: She's well, God bless! She sends you greetings.

sentences.french: Comment je dis ca en Soussou?
sentences.english: How do I say this in Soussou?

sentences.french: Notre bureau ferme a quelle heure?
sentences.english: What time does our office close?

sentences.soussou: Six heures. Mais vendredi cinq heures.
sentences.french: Six heures. Mais vendredi cinq heures.
sentences.english: Six o'clock. But Friday five o'clock.

sentences.french: Et lui/elle? Il/elle ne vient pas?
sentences.english: What about him/her? He/she is not coming?

sentences.soussou: A fafe. Retard un peu tan.
sentences.french: Il/elle vient. Juste un peu en retard.
sentences.english: He/she is coming. Just a bit late.

sentences.french: La pluie s'est arretee? Le soleil arrive?
Oui, les nuages sont partis. Ciel clair.
sentences.english: Yes, clouds are gone. Clear sky.
Is your child going to school?

sentences.soussou: Awa, CP gui. A aime gbo!
sentences.french: Oui, CP cette annee. Il/elle adore!
sentences.english: Yes, first grade this year. He/she loves it!

sentences.soussou: Fa fokhora. N'na i rafa kira.
sentences.french: Suis-moi. Je vais te montrer le chemin.
sentences.english: Follow me. I'll show you the way.

sentences.french: Marche tres bien! Pas de probleme.
Il y a un restaurant pres d'ici?

sentences.soussou: Awa. Tout droit, gauche apres. Bon manger!
sentences.french: Oui. Tout droit, apres a gauche. Bonne bouffe!
sentences.english: Yes. Straight, then left. Good food!

sentences.french: Ils ne connaissent pas ce probleme.
sentences.english: They don't know about this problem.

sentences.french: On doit leur dire. C'est important!

sentences.soussou: Fele bon gbo! Ala xa baraka.
sentences.french: Tres belle vue! Que Dieu benisse.

sentences.soussou: Guinea joli gbo! Whon' kha pays.
sentences.french: La Guinee est tres jolie! Notre pays.
sentences.english: Guinea is very beautiful! Our country.

sentences.soussou: Siga A yire. A besoin aide.
sentences.french: Va chez lui/elle. Il/elle a besoin d'aide.
sentences.english: Go to him/her. He/she needs help.

sentences.soussou: N'na siga maintenant. Khafe mu ra?
sentences.french: J'y vais maintenant. C'est quoi le probleme?
sentences.english: I'm going now. What's the problem?
How much is a kilo of onions?

sentences.french: Cinq mille. Tu en veux combien?
sentences.english: Five thousand. How many do you want?

sentences.french: Attends! Mes affaires ne sont pas pretes.
Est-ce que tu peux faire ca?
sentences.english: Are you able to do this? (genuine question)

sentences.french: Ca ne marche pas. Connexion tres lente!
J'ai beaucoup de choses cette semaine.
sentences.english: I have a lot going on this week.

sentences.french: Courage! La semaine prochaine sera mieux.
sentences.english: Courage! Next week will be better.

sentences.french: Pas la. Au garage. En reparation.
sentences.english: Not here. At the garage. Repair.

sentences.soussou: Awa! Faim gbo. Di ra dege?
sentences.french: Oui! Tres faim. On mange quoi?
sentences.english: Yes! Very hungry. What are we eating?

sentences.french: Pars d'ici! Tu n'es pas le bienvenu.
Bon! Toute la marchandise est prete?
sentences.english: Good! Is all the merchandise ready?

sentences.french: Il est parti au travail. Retour ce soir.
sentences.english: He went to work. Back in the evening.

sentences.french: Oui! Le prix monte chaque semaine.
sentences.english: Yes! Price goes up every week.

sentences.soussou: Nuit yite. Whon' sa siga bangui.
sentences.french: La nuit est tombee. On devrait rentrer.
sentences.english: Night has come. We should go home.

sentences.french: Oui! Il est tres intelligent. Essaie!
sentences.english: Yes! It's very intelligent. Try it!

sentences.french: Tres froid! Avec de la glace.

sentences.soussou: Ala xa whon' kisi! A demain!
sentences.french: Que Dieu nous protege! A demain!
sentences.english: May God protect us! See you tomorrow!
Amen! Good night. See you tomorrow!
